name: Malaria
symptom_text: high fever chills sweating headache body pain nausea vomiting weakness fatigue cyclical fever pattern rigors
triage: URGENT: Start antimalarial immediately. Check for cerebral malaria signs. Monitor vitals every 2 hours. Refer if severe symptoms.

name: Dengue Fever
symptom_text: high fever sudden onset severe headache pain behind eyes muscle pain joint pain rash bleeding gums nausea vomiting abdominal pain
triage: MONITOR CLOSELY: Check platelet count. Hydrate aggressively. Watch for warning signs. Refer immediately if bleeding or shock.

name: Typhoid Fever
symptom_text: sustained fever gradual onset weakness fatigue headache abdominal pain constipation or diarrhea rose spots rash loss of appetite
triage: START ANTIBIOTICS: Blood culture if possible. Monitor temperature. Ensure hydration. Refer if complications suspected.

name: Tuberculosis (Suspect)
symptom_text: chronic cough more than 2 weeks fever night sweats weight loss loss of appetite fatigue chest pain coughing blood hemoptysis
triage: REFER FOR TESTING: Arrange sputum test. Isolate if possible. Start symptom management. Contact tracing needed. DOTS program referral.
contraindications: Do not start TB drugs without confirmation

name: Acute Respiratory Infection / Pneumonia
symptom_text: cough fever chest pain difficulty breathing rapid breathing shortness of breath sputum production chills fatigue decreased oxygen
triage: URGENT IF SEVERE: Start oxygen if SpO2 low. Begin antibiotics. Monitor respiratory rate. Refer if worsening or SpO2 <90%.
contraindications: Avoid cough suppressants if productive cough

name: Severe Dehydration
symptom_text: diarrhea vomiting dry mouth decreased urination sunken eyes lethargy weakness dizziness rapid heartbeat low blood pressure
triage: IMMEDIATE: Start ORS or IV fluids. Monitor urine output. Check electrolytes. Refer if unable to rehydrate orally or shock present.
medications: IV normal saline or Ringer's lactate

name: Acute Diarrheal Disease
symptom_text: loose stools frequent bowel movements abdominal cramps nausea vomiting fever mild dehydration
triage: HYDRATE: Start ORS. Continue feeding. Monitor for dehydration. Zinc for children. Refer if bloody diarrhea or severe dehydration.

name: Asthma Exacerbation
symptom_text: wheezing difficulty breathing chest tightness cough shortness of breath rapid breathing anxiety cannot complete sentences
triage: URGENT: Give bronchodilator immediately. Start oxygen if needed. Oral/IV steroids. Refer if no improvement or severe.

name: Wound Infection / Cellulitis
symptom_text: redness swelling warmth pain pus discharge fever wound spreading redness tender to touch
triage: START ANTIBIOTICS: Clean wound. Drain abscess if present. Tetanus prophylaxis. Monitor for spreading. Refer if necrotizing or systemic.

name: Anemia (Severe)
symptom_text: weakness fatigue pale skin pale conjunctiva shortness of breath dizziness rapid heartbeat cold hands feet headache
triage: REFER IF SEVERE: Iron supplementation. Nutritional counseling. Check for bleeding source. Transfusion if Hb very low. Treat underlying cause.

name: Urinary Tract Infection
symptom_text: burning urination frequent urination urgency lower abdominal pain cloudy urine foul smell fever back pain
triage: START ANTIBIOTICS: Hydrate well. Pain management. Monitor temperature. Refer if pyelonephritis suspected or pregnancy.

name: Heat Stroke / Heat Exhaustion
symptom_text: high body temperature confusion altered mental status hot dry skin or heavy sweating headache dizziness nausea rapid heartbeat
triage: EMERGENCY: Cool immediately. Move to shade. Remove excess clothing. Apply cool water. IV fluids. Monitor temperature continuously. REFER URGENTLY.
contraindications: Do not give antipyretics for heat stroke
